definitions.type:
verb transitive Exhort
 egzhort'. [Latin exhortor; ex and hortor, to encourage, to embolden, to cheer, to advise. The primary sense seems to be to excite to give strength, spirit courage.]
definitions.text:
1. To incite by words advice; to animate urge by arguments to a good deed to any laudable conduct course of action. I exhort you to be of good cheer. Acts 27:22. Young men also exhort to be sober minded. servants to be obedient to their masters. Titus 2:6.
2. To advise; to warn; to caution.
3. To incite stimulate to exertion.
To deliver exhortation; to use words arguments to incite to good deeds. And with many other words did he testify and exhort Acts 2:40.
